title: Is there a statute of limitations on an SBA disaster loan and can they garnish my SSDI after almost 12 years?
question: I recieved an SBA Disaster loan in 1995. I defauled on the loan and according to SBA records the loan was charged off in 2001 with less than a third remaining on the balance.
answers: This loan should be dischargeable in bankruptcy. When you say "the SBA" started garnishing your check in 2011 - I don't understand how that would happen if they charged off the loan - is it a collection agency? Did you file a Claim of Exemption when you received the garnishment? Or attempt to? I'm curious who is "them" that is garnishing your wages? If you don't have money to pay a lawyer to fiile bk you can do it yourself by going to the Self-Help desk at the Woodland Hills bankruptcy court or Public Counsel downtown. I volunteer at Public Counsel and we do intake downtown. If accepted and you likely will be - you will attend a seminar that walks you through the filing process step by step.
